title: How to Reserve a Spot for an Event
content:
If a user asks how to reserve an event:

- Guide them to the CultPass app
- Instruct them to browse the experience catalog and tap 'Reserve'
- If it's a premium or limited event, check if reservation confirmation is required via email
- Remind them to arrive at least 15 minutes early with their QR code visible

**Suggested phrasing:**
"You can reserve an experience by opening the CultPass app, selecting your desired event, and tapping 'Reserve'. Be sure to arrive 15 minutes early with your QR code ready."

title: What's Included in a CultPass Subscription
content:
Each user is entitled to 4 cultural experiences per month, which may include:
- Art exhibitions
- Museum entries
- Music concerts
- Film screenings and more

Some premium experiences may require an additional fee (visible in the app).

**Suggested phrasing:**
"Your CultPass subscription includes 4 curated experiences each month. You can choose from museums, concerts, film events and more. Premium events may have an extra cost, which is shown during reservation."

title: How to Cancel or Pause a Subscription
content:
Users can manage their subscription via the app > 'My Account' > 'Manage Plan'.

- Cancel: Effective at the end of the billing cycle
- Pause: Preserves user data, resumes automatically when reactivated
- Do NOT offer refunds unless approved by support lead

**Suggested phrasing:**
"You can cancel or pause your subscription at any time via the 'My Account' section in the CultPass app. Cancelation takes effect at the end of your billing cycle."

title: How to Handle Login Issues?
content:
Most login issues are resolved with password reset:

- Ask the user to tap 'Forgot Password' on the login screen
- Ensure they are using the correct registered email
- If they did not receive the reset email, check spam folder or retry after 10 minutes
- For persistent login issues, escalate to human support

**Suggested phrasing:**
"Try tapping 'Forgot Password' on the login screen. Make sure you're using the email associated with your account. If the email doesn't arrive, check spam or try again in a few minutes."

title: How to Book for a Group
content:
If a user asks about bringing friends or family:

- Explain that each subscription covers one person
- Direct them to 'Invite Friends' in the app to purchase guest passes
- Maximum of 3 guest passes per event, subject to availability
- Guests must check in with the primary subscriber

Suggested phrasing:
"You can bring guests by purchasing guest passes in the app under the 'Invite Friends' section for each specific event. Each member can bring up to 3 guests per booking."

title: Lost QR Code or Entry Ticket
content:
For users unable to find their entry code:

- Advise checking the 'Upcoming Events' tab in the app
- Confirm if they received the confirmation email (can be used as backup)
- If the app is down, the event host can look up their name on the guest list with a valid ID

Suggested phrasing:
"Don't worry! You can find your QR code in the 'Upcoming Events' section of the app. If you can't access the app, just show a photo ID to the event host at the entrance."

title: Changing the Location of your Subscription
content:
When a user moves or travels to a new city:

- Instruct them to go to 'Profile' > 'City Preference'
- Changing the city updates the experience catalog immediately
- No extra fee for changing regions within the same country

Suggested phrasing:
"You can update your city at any time in your Profile settings. This will refresh your catalog to show experiences available in your current location."

title: Submitting a Refund Request for a Premium Event
content:
Policy for additional fee events:

- Refund only possible if requested 48 hours before the event
- No-shows are not eligible for refunds
- If the event was cancelled by the host, refund is automatic within 5-7 business days

Suggested phrasing:
"Refunds for premium events are available if requested at least 48 hours in advance. If the host cancels, your refund will be processed automatically."

title: Health and Safety Requirements
content:
General guidance for physical or outdoor events:

- Advise users to check the 'Safety' tab on the specific event page
- Mention that some tours require comfortable shoes or specific gear
- Remind them to stay hydrated for outdoor tours in Brazil

Suggested phrasing:
"Please check the 'Safety' section on the event page for specific requirements like footwear or sun protection. We recommend staying hydrated for all outdoor tours!"

title: How the Referral Program Works
content:
Incentives for bringing new users:

- Users get 1 extra experience credit for every friend who signs up
- The friend must complete their first month for the credit to apply
- Max 5 referral credits per year

Suggested phrasing:
"Invite a friend using your unique link in 'My Account'. Once they complete their first month, we'll add an extra experience credit to your balance!"

title: Reporting a Bug in the App
content:
Technical support routing:

- Ask the user for their device type (iOS/Android) and app version
- Request a screenshot if possible
- If the bug prevents booking, escalate to the technical support lead immediately

Suggested phrasing:
"We're sorry for the trouble. Could you let us know your device type and what happened? A screenshot would be very helpful for our tech team to fix this."

title: Waitlist Policy for Sold Out Events
content:
Managing high-demand experiences:

- Users can tap 'Notify Me' on sold-out events
- If a spot opens up, a push notification is sent to everyone on the waitlist
- It is first-come, first-served once the notification goes out

Suggested phrasing:
"If an event is full, tap 'Notify Me' to join the waitlist. We'll send a push notification to everyone if a spot opens up, so act fast when you get the alert!"

title: Age Restrictions for Experiences
content:
Policies for minors and families:

- Most events are 18+ unless marked 'Family Friendly'
- Minors must be accompanied by an adult subscriber
- Some nightlife events are strictly 21+

Suggested phrasing:
"Most of our experiences are for adults, but look for the 'Family Friendly' tag for events suitable for minors. Please note that some evening events have strict age limits."

title: Updating Payment Methods
content:
Handling expired cards or billing changes:

- Navigate to 'My Account' > 'Billing' > 'Payment Method'
- We accept all major credit cards and Pix (in Brazil)
- Failed payments will result in a 3-day grace period before subscription pause

Suggested phrasing:
"You can update your card or switch to Pix under 'Billing' in the 'My Account' section. If a payment fails, you'll have 3 days to update it before your access is paused."

title: Weather Cancellation Policy
content:
For outdoor experiences (Paddleboarding, Bike Rides, etc.):

- The host makes the final call 2 hours before the event start time
- If cancelled due to weather, the experience credit is refunded immediately
- Users are notified via App Push and SMS
- If the user decides not to go but the event is NOT cancelled, no refund is provided

Suggested phrasing:
"For outdoor activities, the host decides on cancellations 2 hours before start time based on safety. If cancelled, your credit is returned instantly. Otherwise, the standard attendance policy applies."

title: Corporate and Team Building Requests
content:
When a user asks about bulk bookings for companies:

- CultPass offers 'CultPass for Business' for teams of 10+
- Do NOT handle these via the standard support flow
- Direct the user to fill out the form at https://www.google.com/search?q=cultpass.com/business
- Mention that corporate plans include dedicated account management

Suggested phrasing:
"We have specialized plans for teams! For groups of 10 or more, please visit our business page at https://www.google.com/search?q=cultpass.com/business so our corporate team can assist you directly."

title: Equipment and Rentals
content:
Guidance on gear for experiences:

- All essential safety gear (helmets, life vests) is included in the booking
- Personal items (towels, water bottles) are usually not provided
- Check the 'What to Bring' section in the experience details
- If equipment is damaged by a user, they may be liable for a repair fee

Suggested phrasing:
"All necessary safety equipment is included with your reservation. We recommend checking the 'What to Bring' section in the app for personal items you might need during the tour."

title: How to Leave an Experience Review
content:
Encouraging community feedback:

- Users can rate experiences 1-5 stars after the event ends
- The review prompt appears in the app 30 minutes after the scheduled end time
- Photos can be uploaded alongside text reviews
- Negative reviews are flagged for host improvement

Suggested phrasing:
"We value your feedback! You'll see a prompt in the app shortly after your experience ends where you can rate the host and share your photos with the community."

title: Accessing Past Billing Invoices
content:
How to retrieve tax or payment receipts:

- Invoices are available under 'My Account' > 'Billing History'
- Users can download PDF versions of all past transactions
- Invoices are generated at the moment the billing cycle starts

Suggested phrasing:
"You can view and download all your past invoices as PDFs by going to 'My Account' and selecting 'Billing History' in the CultPass app."

title: Wait-time Policy for Late Arrivals
content:
Handling users who are running late:

- Standard grace period is 10 minutes for guided tours
- For theater or timed entry museums, late entry may be strictly prohibited
- If a user misses the start, the credit is considered used
- Advise users to message the host directly via the app if they are delayed

Suggested phrasing:
"Most hosts have a 10-minute grace period, but some events start strictly on time. If you're running late, please use the app to message your host directly to see if they can accommodate you."

title: Gift Card Redemption
content:
How to apply a gift to an account:

- Navigate to 'Manage Plan' > 'Redeem Code'
- Gift cards apply a balance to the account for premium fees or subscription months
- Cannot be exchanged for cash

Suggested phrasing:
"To redeem your gift, go to 'Manage Plan' in your account settings and enter your code. The balance will be applied to your account for your next billing cycle or premium booking."

title: Host No-Show Protocol
content:
Action to take if the guide/host is missing:

- Ask the user to wait at the meeting point for 15 minutes
- Instruct the user to take a photo of the location as proof of attendance
- Escalate to 'Urgent Support' immediately to verify host location
- Full refund and an extra credit are provided for verified host no-shows

Suggested phrasing:
"I'm so sorry for the inconvenience. Please stay at the location for 15 minutes and take a photo of the meeting point. I am escalating this to our urgent support team right now to investigate."

title: Accessibility and Special Needs
content:
Information for users with disabilities:

- Look for the 'Universal Access' icon on experience pages
- Some historical sites (like Olinda) have uneven terrain and limited wheelchair access
- Users can request specific assistance from hosts via the 'Pre-event Chat'

Suggested phrasing:
"We strive for inclusivity! Please look for the 'Universal Access' icon on event pages. You can also chat with your host before the event to discuss any specific assistance you might need."

title: Changing your Registered Email Address
content:
Security procedure for account updates:

- User must go to 'Profile' > 'Security' > 'Change Email'
- A verification link is sent to the OLD email address first
- If they lost access to the old email, escalate to human support for identity verification

Suggested phrasing:
"For security, you can change your email in the 'Security' section of your profile. You'll need to click a confirmation link sent to your current email to authorize the change."
